subject: Investing
title: Stocks vs. Bonds vs. Cash
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Stocks vs. Bonds vs. Cash.

hook.text: Stocks, bonds, and cash are the three building blocks. Each behaves differently when markets move.

buildup.text: Stocks offer ownership and growth potential. Bonds are loans that pay interest. Cash sits safe but idle.

discovery.text: Since 1926, US stocks averaged about 10% annually. Bonds returned 5%. Cash barely beat inflation.

twist.text: Higher returns come with higher risk. Stocks can drop 50% in a year. Bonds rarely lose more than 10%.

climax.text: Most portfolios blend all three. Your age, goals, and stomach for risk decide the proportions.

punchline.text: Stocks grow wealth. Bonds protect it. Cash provides breathing room.

quiz.question: Since 1926, what has been the average annual return of US stocks?
